metadata.story_name:
Twenty years ago Elf Mountain was taken.

Now it is time to take it back.

It was home to the purebred Sanate elves, and also their cousins, Mākai elves, commonly known as wood elves.

Within its heart was the Jinta crystal - huge, running the length of the mountain, solid on the outside but vibrant with liquid magma coursing through it.

While the Sanate elves attended it, it provided the natural energy for crops, creatures and peoples in the surrounding lands to do well and prosper.

Then the Garginoids invaded.  Times before they had been repelled, but this time they were organised and determined.  They seized the mountain, and forced most of the elves out.
They thought they could control the Jinta.

They could stifle it - but they could not fully control it.

The Sanate elves turned to stone as the Garginoids corrupted its power.
The Mākai elves, however, were able to escape and make homes elsewhere.

All over the land, crop yields were high, and deaths from disease increased.  The sky just seemed a little greyer.

The Garginoids also suffered.  They became unable to reproduce, and struggled to obtain enough food.  Of course, they terrorised nearby villages for resources.

The average life span of a Garginoid is fifty years.  So, now, twenty years later, it is reckoned safe to return.  The elves have built themselves up and acquired some new friends.  The Garginoids they calculate are now of reduced numbers, and advanced age…

However, the journey will not be easy.  Where once there was harmony and justice, now there is suspicion and fear.  Hard, even wicked rulers have replaced benign ones; and cruel creatures have moved into the region...

writing_prompt: In the heart of a misty elven forest, a ragtag group of adventurers gathers for a perilous quest—one promising unimaginable rewards, justice for the land, and a chance to rewrite their destinies. But will the promise of glory outweigh the dangers lurking in the shadows?

metadata.story_name:
*We wandered off like children in the woods*
*And let the searchers come but never find us*
*Tried to make a life among the trees*
*While your dreams collected planes and cars and cities*

*You slipped away from me while I was sleeping*
*To climb the tallest oak and see the lights*
*Your dissatisfaction gave you questions*
*Do you remember what the city sounded like?*

-----------------------------------------

The characters in this game are determined to start  a new life, back to nature, in a fruitful jungle.

Life is good.

Key to the story is that the island they move to is an absolute paradise.  However, when the characters sleep, they dream.

And when they dream, their heads get filled with memories, aspirations, fears.

Gradually, the more they dream, the dreams affect them, and push them towards going to a different life.

The dreams are subtle, but like an enemy.

Some realise what is happening, others do not.

**Can they keep their community together?**

--------------------

Rotating narration is available but you only narrate if you are comfortable with it, and you will be supported if you are new to it.

writing_prompt: A group of strangers, united only by an online blog and a shared dream of escaping modern life, secretly boards a ship bound for a remote, uninhabited island to start anew. What awaits them in their quest for paradise?

metadata.story_name:
Twenty years ago Elf Mountain was taken.

Now it is time to take it back.

It was home to the purebred Sanate elves, and also their cousins, Mākai elves, commonly known as wood elves.

Within its heart was the Jinta crystal - huge, running the depth of the mountain, solid on the outside but vibrant with liquid magma coursing through it.

While the Sanate elves attended it, it provided the natural energy for crops, creatures and peoples in the surrounding lands to do well and prosper.

Then the Garginoids invaded.  Times before they had been repelled, but this time they were organised and determined.  They seized the mountain, and forced most of the elves out.
They thought they could control the Jinta.

They could stifle it - but they could not fully control it.

The Sanate elves turned to stone as the Garginoids corrupted its power.

The Mākai elves, however, were able to escape and make homes elsewhere.

All over the land, crop yields were high, and deaths from disease increased.  The sky just seemed a little greyer.

The Garginoids also suffered.  They became unable to reproduce, and struggled to obtain enough food.  Of course, they terrorised nearby villages for resources.

The average life span of a Garginoid is fifty years.  So, now, twenty years later, it is reckoned safe to return.  The elves have built themselves up and acquired some new friends.  The Garginoids they calculate are now of reduced numbers, and advanced age…

A plot was hatched.  Brave souls set out on the dangerous journey to approach the mountain.

Many fell in their efforts.  However, a bold scout made good progress through some of the treacherous towns of men, finding that where once there was harmony and justice, now there was suspicion and fear.  Hard, even wicked rulers have replaced benign ones; and cruel creatures have moved into the region...

We now join that scout, as he makes the best alliance he can, to complete his quest...

writing_prompt: In a land where alliances are forged out of desperation, a ragtag group of halflings, goblins, a disgraced dwarf, and a disorganized elf gather in a tavern to plan the impossible—retaking Elf Mountain from the Garginoids and restoring the Jinta crystal’s power. What could possibly go wrong?

metadata.story_name:
*We wandered off like children in the woods*
*And let the searchers come but never find us*
*Tried to make a life among the trees*
*While your dreams collected planes and cars and cities*

*You slipped away from me while I was sleeping*
*To climb the tallest oak and see the lights*
*Your dissatisfaction gave you questions*
*Do you remember what the city sounded like?*

-----------------------------------------

The characters in this game have started a new life, on an idyllic island.  They are determined to start  afresh, back to nature, in a fruitful jungle.

Life is good.

Key to the story is that the island they move to is an absolute paradise.  However, when the characters sleep, they dream.

And when they dream, their heads get filled with memories, aspirations, fears.

Gradually, the more they dream, the dreams affect them, and push them towards going to a different life.

The dreams are subtle, but like an enemy.

Some realise what is happening, others do not.

**Can they keep their community together?**

--------------------

Rotating narration is available but you only narrate if you are comfortable with it, and you will be supported if you are new to it.

writing_prompt: A group of settlers arrives at a remote and untouched paradise, ready to build a new life from scratch—but as they begin to shape their future, they must confront not only the challenges of the land but also the secrets and doubts they each carry.

metadata.story_name:
A time travel adventure based on the British TV series Doctor Who.
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=zETK7aQhc_E

This is a fast paced game, with most players contributing daily. ** But** we are welcoming, and we will make it work if you can't post that often.  
*If you think you might like to play, better to try out than miss out...*

New players welcome.

Player characters should not be resolutely evil - they need to have enough good in them to be allied to the essentially good party.  

All characters should have some link to the Dr Who series, be it the development of a minor (or major!) character we have already met, or a member of a familiar species.

The Doctor him/her self only shows up rarely - this is a spin-off story.  
We intend to play fast and for a long time - but you can drop in for a few scenes if you like.   
Feel free to ask with any questions.

**I would want any player to tell me if I need to adjust to increase their access.  I think in particular of those with sight impairment and the use of art, but I include anything I have not thought of.**

Please contact me as to how best to join the game if you need inspiration!

---------------------------------------
#**Starting location:**
[The starting location mentioned below is slightly misleading...  I think things probably will kick off here, but we won't be here - or then - for very long at all!] 
**Nuacruz Galaxy**.  One of the Ten Galaxies.  
Galaxy formally ruled by the Dominators, though these have been purged from this Galaxy now as a number of the planets have fought effectively against them and the effort of maintaining control was not deemed worthwhile by the Dominators.
**Andertenna Planet** Made hosptitable by the Gond after their home planet became uninhabitable.  Kroton occupation had led to the Gond having an accellerated evolution of intelligence and an aversion to violence and oppression.  However technological advances also lead to global warming and polution and their former home is now a wasteland known as Gond1.  They relocated to Andertenna.  They are the most populous speicies though a number of other  species have also now settled here and become a full part of society.

Adventures are spread across time and space, but there are some key locations which feel like "home" to the characters:
Some key locations
**Neonharper City** - location of the famed University.  This is the only significant city on the planet, although there are a few small outlying towns.
**Andertenna** is a naturally dusty, reddish planet which is just warm enough to support life and is in a state of almost perpetual dusk.  At night  the sky is navy blue, most of the day it is purple and around noon it is pink.  Vents pump out breathable warmed air - engineering and barriers recirculate air at ground level for as long as possible to assist the thin natural atmosphere in retaining it.  Due to the difficulty in maintaining air quality away from the centre, the price of land is at a premium.

It is 3037, and Ludwig is President in Andertenna.
It was the 82nd Century, in the Sigma system, and James wants to head back to the 31st Century, Sigma 19, to track down some old...associates...

writing_prompt: The TARDIS crew arrives in a future version of a familiar city, only to discover that one of their own has somehow become its president, complete with towering statues and propaganda songs. But how did this happen, and what secrets lie behind the smoke billowing from the colossal monument?

metadata.story_name:
**I would want any player to tell me if I need to adjust to increase their access.**

#About the story

##The story is in progress; but it is modular and a new ship has joined the story - as a member of the crew, you will not need to know anything that has gone before from other player's perspective, and will be able to shape the character of the new ship!

Join the space crew on a new mission.

You are keen for adventure, and this ship offers the opportunity to get out there and explore the Universe.

Pirates come in all shapes and sizes.  Officially you are after the rogue ships.  But sometimes to really bring justice you need to go after the rogue lawyers, the corrupt politicians, the faces behind the faceless corporations....

For too long so-called "mining" companies have been permitted to put profit above ethics, bringing misery to the populations of planets they exploit.  There are plenty of others of players and examples in the web of deceit.

But it is not easy to tell the good from the grey, and harder still to fight the cause without unwanted consequences.

writing_prompt: In a lawless port town where local thugs keep outsiders in check and the government turns a blind eye, a cyborg tactician named Cypreece searches for new crew members and resources—while navigating a world where pirates come in many unexpected forms.

metadata.story_name:
A sci/fi time travel adventure loosely based on the British TV series Doctor Who, without a need for canon knowledge.

---
This game is nearing the end, but I have the lobby open so newcomers can make contact and get signposted to a suitable game.

---


https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=zETK7aQhc_E

This is a fast paced game, played in a welcoming way to meet the needs of each player.

*If you think you might like to play, better to try out than miss out...*

---

##Leaders from across the galaxy are planning to build a taskforce to take the fight to the daleks for once and for all.

##Peace at any cost?  Is any price worth paying for peace?  What is going to far? And if you create a force that can drive out the greatest threat, how do you prevent that becoming the threat once the evil it was designed to counter is gone?

##Even as these decisions are grappled with, democracy is under threat in unexpected ways, and there are other troubling developments....

writing_prompt: In a sprawling alien art gallery turned conference venue, you're tasked with managing intergalactic delegates, ensuring everyone—from one-eyed Alpha Centaurians to icy warriors—finds their way without sparking a diplomatic incident. What could possibly go wrong?

metadata.story_name:
####Comedy

*This game is presented as a chance for people new to Storium to get to grips with things and ask questions, as they find their way to additional games.  You might see this to the end, or it would be acceptable to leave once you are established.*
I will have less internet access for the coming week - I will respond to you, but my typing may be erratic and short as I am using a portable device.

---
So now we are all in trouble.

The Emperor had new clothes.  Take the old ones to the incinerator, he said.  Such sad rags should not be associated with me.

So his footman did take them down to the incinerator.

Except at the incinerator, they said that would be a waste.  Take them to the Royal Housekeeper to make them into blankets for the widows and orphans of the city.

So the incinerator sweeper did just that and went to the Housekeepers assistant.

But the Housekeeper's assistant had a better idea.  Those clothes would not make good blankets, and they are worth more intact.  So sell them, and the money can be used to buy more, better things for the poor.

So they were taken to the Mistress of the Robes, who sold them to a supplier for a bag of gold.

That supplier sold them on to another merchant, who took them out of town, seeking a great price from the nobility.

Now the Emperor has nothing to wear for the banquet tonight.  So he has sent his messenger to the incinerator, charged with being sure to run and get there before it is too late.  On pain of death.

As I say, now we are all in trouble.

writing_prompt: On the day of a grand royal banquet, whispers spread through the bustling city of Heartvale: the Emperor's finest clothes have mysteriously vanished. As the Mistress of the Robes, a frantic messenger, and a scheming merchant cross paths, the question remains—who will claim the garments, and at what cost?

metadata.story_name:
##*Fantasy Game.  For people who want to get on with it! Spell-casting, diplomacy and adventure.*
**Underlying story with a lot of scope for player story-telling.**

---


This is intended to be a fast game, ***for players who want to get on with it***.  We will start as soon as we have some characters, and new players will be welcome to join as we go.

New players welcome - and as such, when I say it is fast, that is the broad aim, but we will go at the pace  of the players.  Have a go and I will guide you - or ask questions in the lobby (or PM me)

It is a fantasy theme in a unique game universe with no canon to worry about. Spell-casting, diplomacy and adventure.  A proper story but not too serious with scope for humour.

---

The Land is called Pucia.  Pronounced Puck-ia by the Birdfolk and Puce-ia by the Glass Golems.  The Rubber Trolls call it Puke-ia.

After a time of uneasy peace, tensions have risen between the Glass Golems and the Rubber Trolls is on the verge of breaking out.  As a player, you have the opportunity to shape huge amounts of the back story and the way magic works in this land.

writing_prompt: When trolls take up residence under a vital bridge, tensions rise between Birdfolk, Golems, and Trolls, each group teetering on the edge of conflict. Will peace prevail, or will one spark ignite a war none of them can afford?

metadata.story_name:
#A sci/fi time travel adventure loosely based on the British TV series Doctor Who, without a need for canon knowledge.


The Doctor does not appear as a major character - this is a spin off story.  You really do not *need* to know anything about the original.



---


https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=zETK7aQhc_E


---


*If you think you might like to play, better to try out than miss out...*

---

###You play a member of an investigator team, looking into strange events and unravelling mysteries...

Year: Late 3038

Coming up: 4025

writing_prompt: On the enigmatic planet of Sigma19, where opulent rooftop gardens crown layered city blocks, strange deaths linked to little red flowers spark intrigue. As a journalist, a detective, and a time-traveling AI dog converge, they uncover a web of political intrigue, intergalactic diplomacy, and a deadly mystery that threatens the fragile Galactic Federation. What secrets lie buried beneath Sigma19's blooming facade?
